result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa A Pallagi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit For Time Served 1 Day, If Revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cost/Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 10-01-2015.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal cases pending.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Maintain a valid driver's license.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Court suggests the Agent and Defendant to review if NA is appropriate.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Each year of Probation to be performed in a drug rehabilitation center and to be completed in the 10th month of the Second Year of Probation.

If the Officer is available the court will hear the trial.
